A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It takes a lot of guts to make a movie you believe in. Rian Johnson did just that. While TLJ isn't perfect\, it is much better than people are giving it credit for. From reading a lot of the fan reviews\, it just strikes me that people are just finding reasons to hate.  In many instances on RotTom\, I don't care what critics say or think. I make decisions as to how I'm going to spend my ticket money. I say this because sometimes the critics are off by a wide margin. I check the fan reviews because most people don't have a dog in the fight (other than their own entertainment) the fans were wrong on this movie. It's striking out on it's own (which isn't bad) and it was well cast. I encourage anyone who reads this to actually watch the movie if you love the Star Wars films. Make your own decision. Rant about it online (just like me)
